detail.desc: Before you get your shipment to UPS, follow a few simple steps to prepare your package or freight for shipment. Select a link below to learn more.

Good packaging can help your shipment arrive on time and in good condition. Select a link below for helpful packaging information and recommendations, weight and size guidelines, and hoe to measure for dimensional weight and girth.
From peanuts to foam and all project in-between, there are many options for inernal-cushioning materials to use when packing your shipment. Select the link below to learn more.
Find out how to handle items that are regulated or shipments that require special care when packaging.
Learn what documentation is required for international and domestic shipments. Also see which UPS forms, supplies, and labels are available for use with your UPS shipments.

howTo.introductory: Get helpful information on how to use ups.com

collapsables.question: Why can't I see my negotiated rates?
collapsables.answer:
WorldShip® displays both published and negotiated rates. If you are unable to view your negotiated rates, refer to the Rating Preferences tab in the Shipper Editor. This allows you to select the rate types to display in the:

  • Shipping and Shipment History Windows
  • Package and Shipment Doc Labels
  • Daily Shipment Detail Report

collapsables.question: What dangerous goods can be shipped and what is the process?
collapsables.answer: Visit the Hazardous Materials Guide to review current information and user guide for safety and processes for successfully shipping hazardous materials domestically and internationally.

collapsables.question: What is the process to ship internationally?
collapsables.answer: Our goal is to make shipping with UPS as easy and seamless as possible. Visit our Shipping Basics and How To Prepare for Shipping pages to learn fundamentals from choosing your service to preparing your package and what you need before completing an international shipment.

collapsables.question: How can I prevent address correction charges?
collapsables.answer: Preventing address correction charges is as simple as making sure the address is accurate on the shipping label for your package. If you are an individual shipper or receiver and need to change an address or delivery time to fit your convenience, visit the UPS My Choice Change Delivery page for more information. Addressing and rerouting capabilities are also available in UPS visibility tools for business, such as Quantum View, Flex Global View, WorldShip and UPS CampusShip.

collapsables.question: How much does it cost to ship a package?
collapsables.answer: Shipping cost depends on origin, destination, service, package weight, and other considerations. Calculate Time and Cost helps you compare delivery times and published rates for sending UPS shipments to destinations around the world.

items.toggle_title: After Your Shipment Has Been Processed

collapsables.question: How many days will it take for my package to be delivered?
collapsables.answer: To calculate the delivery time for any shipment going anywhere served by UPS, go to Calculate Time and Cost, located on the Shipping tab of ups.com. Follow the directions, noting the required fields labeled with this symbol.

collapsables.question: Why wasn't my package delivered in three days, as indicated?
collapsables.answer: Three days means three business days (not counting the day of pickup). Please note that the UPS Service Guarantee applies only to business days, and excludes weekends, holidays, and any delays that occur beyond the control of UPS.

collapsables.question: How do I void a shipment?
collapsables.answer:
Follow these steps to void shipments made within the last 90 days:

1. Log into ups.com.
2. Select Shipping at the top of the page.
3. Under Existing Shipments, select Void Shipment.
4. Select the shipment you want to void.
5. Select Void Shipment.
